answers.author: Maria Ratliff
answers.text:
Our department has an honor guard. The guard is entirely voluntary, although we do give compensation in the form of comp time. We try our best to utilize on duty personnel for honor guard events. This is for the convenience of personnel and also to avoid the expense of comp time. Uniforms and any associated expenses, such as additional equipment, fuel for travel, etc. comes out of the operations budget. The team is provided a vehicle for use for all events. Generally, this is an SUV assigned to the training division. However, vehicles assigned to fire inspectors, the safety officer, even the fire chief, have been used in the past.

author: Jessie Levine
text: If your community has an honor guard in your police or fire departments, are they supported by municipal resources or are they entirely on volunteer or union time?  Do you have an agreement with your honor guard about use of Town vehicles and resources?
title: Fire Department Honor Guards
